page.title: 04MEDIA
page.content: North Gwynedds' main paper is the {North Wales Weekly News},which has its head office and works situated on the edge of the Conwy River. Due to the expansion of the company this is the second site,originally it was sited on the quay at Conwy,this is now a bandstand.With further expansion over the past five years (1980-85),it has incorporated other regional newspapers such as the{Caernarvon and Denbigh {Herald.}Originally the paper was printed with line o'type machines taking a long time.With the need for modernisation it is now assembled and printed with the aid of computers and other high-technology machines.Further expansion of the site is visualized for the future due to the prosperity and popularity of the paper. by Anna Jones.
